newsitem.title: UK: Halifax jumps ahead of FTSE 100 debut.
newsitem.headline: Halifax jumps ahead of FTSE 100 debut.

text.p: Halifax Plc jumped in active trading on Friday as institutions loaded up on the shares ahead of their June 23 entry into the FTSE 100, dealers said.
By 0812 GMT, Halifax shares were up 21-1/2p to 766-1/2 on volume of 2.7 million shares.
"We're still seeing a lot of institutional demand," said one market maker. "Weightings are still low."
They said the stock also was boosted ahead of meetings Halifax has scheduled with brokers. Talk of possible recommendations lifted the shares late Thursday, as well, dealers said.
